text.b: Task Allocation for On-orbit Servicing Spacecrafts Using Discrete

text.i: Department of Control Engineering Naval Aeronautical and Astronautical University,
Department of Computer Science and Technology, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China,
No. 91913 Unit of PLA, Dalian, China
The on-orbit servicing task is very important to improve the cooperative work ratio of the on-orbit
servicing spacecrafts. In order to solve multi-constrained on-orbit servicing task allocation for
spacecrafts, the programming of on-orbit servicing task allocation for spacecraft in orbit was studied.
By analyzing the critical index factors which contain target satellite value, servicing spacecraft loss
and energy-time consumption, an on-orbit servicing spacecraft task allocation model is formulated. A
discrete particle swarm optimization (DPSO) algorithm is put forward for this problem. A new code of
particles and new update strategy for the position and speed of particles are applied. The simulation
results indicate that the DPSO algorithm is a feasible approach and also can solve the on-orbit
servicing spacecraft cooperative task allocation effectively.
On-orbit Servicing, Servicing Spacecraft, Task Allocation,

page.text: On-orbit servicing will be a new and independent research direction in the fast development
. On-orbit servicing can extend the lifespan of satellites, space station sub-
module and space launch vehicles. It may be proposed to change the design model of the
spacecraft fundamentally. It also affects the space infrastructure and greatly reduces spacecraft
. At the end of the 20th century and beginning of 21st century,
the United States commenced space autonomous on-orbit servicing technology research and
testing, and strengthened study on dynamics in recent years. Major research projects include
experimental satellite system (XSS) and the "Orbital Express" program, etc. These two
programs have been successfully validated by autonomous rendezvous and docking, on-orbit
filling and on-orbit hardware replacement technology on behalf of key on-orbit servicing
technologies. Space autonomous on-orbit servicing technology has demonstrated a strong
adaptability in all aspects of service, and its low cost, high value in military. Thus it has
attracted much attention in aerospace industry. What is the most important is how to allocate
tasks for multiple SSs on such constraint conditions as losses, energy and time, while at the
same time maximize the benefits in general(SS denotes the servicing spacecraft while TS
At present, China and other countries have carried out some related research. For example,
Wu Yufei proposed the multi-agent model based on contract net protocol, but do not take into
account many factors, such as obstacle avoidance problem. Shen Haijun studied on-orbit
servicing planning issues about a SS which performs multiple tasks on a circular orbit
K.T.Alfriend investigated the optimal service strategy about a SS which performs multiple tasks
. However, none of them can solve the coordination problem among
multiple SSs. Moreover, the study on SS task allocation is even less. The current studies are
mostly based on uninhabited aerial vehicle (UAV) task allocation in coordinated operations.
. Although the model is simple and easy to implement, the
objective function is too simple and is not well suited to describe the key indicators of
Task Allocation for On-orbit Servicing Spacecrafts Using Discrete Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm
Zhang Qi-xin, Sun Fu-chun, Xiong Wei
International Journal of Advancements in Computing Technology(IJACT)
Therefore, according to the characteristic of on-orbit SS cooperative task allocation problem,
this paper designs a new particle swarm position and velocity updating formula, and suggests a
method of multi-servicing spacecrafts cooperative target allocation based on a discrete particle
swarm optimization algorithm. Simulation results show that the algorithm can solve the problem,
and the algorithm is simple, flexible, and easy to implement.
After on-orbit SSs get instruction, it needs to shift from preparation orbit to servicing orbit
which is close to the TS. Meanwhile, on-orbit spacecraft is active, and called for tracking
spacecraft, while the target in need of services is a passive, that is the TS. The orbit transfer
process can be illustrated by fig. 1. The value of different TS is different, and the process of
implementation service is subject to loss, energy and time constraints. Task allocation is to
select each service target for each SS, while achieving maximum overall revenue, loss minimum.
In initial time, servicing spacecraft and auxiliary spacecraft are in the orbit. After task
allocation, spacecrafts carry out a wide range of orbit maneuvering to target satellite which
make it possible to perform on-orbit servicing in a proper distance.In considering its own
performance and surrounding environment constraints, SSs are in low orbit. SSs are able to
conduct double-pulse orbit transfer to the TSs’ orbit high orbit according to the results of a
reasonable task allocation. First pulse is applied at the initial rendezvous while a second pulse
when closing to the TS(See figure 2).

According to the above model analysis, the SS task allocation model contains multiple sub-goals.
Moreover, a conflict often exists among each target functions. If a goal is regarded as optimal objective
with a constraint method, the other as a constraint, then its scope is difficult to determine. The
weighted sum is a common method which can convert multi-objective decision problem to a single-
objective optimization problem. We can simply consider the various sub-target target weighting and
optimization, and the weight values reflect the importance of sub-objective function while the
weighting coefficient is confirmed by the ground commanders who accurately grasp the target state
SS task allocation should meet the following constraints:

text.b: 4. Discrete Particle Swarm Optimization for Spacecrafts Task Allocation

page.text: Particle swarm optimization (PSO) is proposed by Kennedy and Eberhart in 1995. It has such
features as a small number of individuals, simple calculating and good robust. With PSO algorithm,
each particle is an alternative solution, a number of particles coexistence, cooperation and optimization.
According to the experience of particle group, each particle flies to a better position in the problem
space, searching the optimal solution. Particles themselves are to find the optimal solution called
individual optimal value pBest, that is, each particle experience the best location during the flight. At
present, the whole group has found the optimal solution known as the global optimal value gBest, that
is, the groups occurred the best position
. The standard particle swarm optimization is for the
continuous systems, and is not suitable for solving the discrete problem. In order to solve SS
coordinated target assignment problem, we design a discrete particle swarm target allocation algorithm.
According to the characteristics of the problem, we also design a natural number coding of the discrete
particle swarm algorithm, and builds the corresponding relationship between the practical problems
and the particle, and also makes the corresponding improvement to the standard PSO
Task Allocation for On-orbit Servicing Spacecrafts Using Discrete Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm
Zhang Qi-xin, Sun Fu-chun, Xiong Wei

equals to target number, which means a possible distribution program. For example, the target number
of spacecraft n equals to 3, the target number m equals to 4, and a particle is

need to fulfil tasks within the stipulated time in order to achieve the best overall performance.

Genetic Algorithm (GA) and DPSO are used in Scenario 1. After thirty iterations, the best
solutions, average solutions and the worst solutions by means of two algorithms are obtained, from
which the task allocation for on-orbit SS are summarized in Table 5. From the results in Table 5, the
optimal solutions and the task allocations of two algorithms are accordant with small scale for
servicing spacecraft(SS) and target satellite (TS). And the optimal allocation is: SS-1 to TS-2, SS-2 to
TS-4 and TS-5, SS-3 to TS-1 and TS-3. Though the performances of them are nearly the same in small-
scaling allocation, the advantage of DPSO will be shown later in large-scaling task allocation

With thirty iterations, the performance curves of these two algorithms in Example Two are shown
in Fig.a-Fig.c, respectively, and the results are summarized in Table 7. The difference between two
algorithms can be found in this large-scaling task allocation. From Fig.c, the convergence speed of
DPSO is faster than that of GA, i.e., DPSO can obtain the optimal solution faster. And from the curve
of average solution for DPSO, particles will not converge to the same even in later iteration, which
shows that the algorithm has better ability for optimal solution
Task Allocation for On-orbit Servicing Spacecrafts Using Discrete Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm
Zhang Qi-xin, Sun Fu-chun, Xiong Wei
Table 7. Performance comparison of two algorithms
The best solution after iteration 30 times 4.8386 4.9718
The average solution after iteration 30 times 3.9303 4.8193
The worst solution after iteration 30 times 2.9912 4.3465
The best solution after iteration 60 times 4.7658 4.9718
The average solution after iteration 60 times 4.0412 4.7669
The worst solution after iteration 60 times 2.8224 4.0716
It can be seen from the results that by increasing the number of iterations, the algorithm are more
likely to find the optimal solution. At the same time, the optimal, average, worst values are reduced,
that is, the algorithm has better chance to find solution in short time and solves the On-Orbit SS
With the property of on-orbit SS cooperative task allocation, new updating equations of
positions and velocities for discrete particle swarm are designed in this paper, and a cooperative
task allocation method is proposed based on DPSO. According to simulations, the improved
PSO algorithm can obtain optimal allocation faster and steadier and also is effective to solve
cooperative task allocation for SS under restrictions effectively.
